utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi, good morning.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is %uh tour guide one,

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: my name is Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh hi-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: How can I-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hi Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm participant number twenty three.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I am Guine Siobal.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um Lynnette, I'm planning to visit Singapore this coming April twenty first and twenty second can you tell me more about Singapore please?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh which area %uh do you want me to tell you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um we're planning to go to Singapore Flyer and Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you have two days in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I- %uh Singapore Flyer is located on the Southern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh it will take you approximately about forty minutes to %uh do this %um %uh to give you panoramic view of the Marina Bay area as well as the %uh Financial District Area of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if it's on the fine day, you can even get to see %uh Indonesian Riau Islands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so %uh the first picture that is actually the Singapore Flyer and %uh you, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see you'll be going onto the capsule.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um what about the best time to take a ride?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you have specific that I can %um take a ride so we can view most beautiful part of the Marina Island?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can either take %uh the whole day, it's fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um unless it is raining, then otherwise %uh morning you get a different kind of view.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: evening if you're taking at night that's also nice, because then you see the lights coming on %um in the southern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So either morning, it's a bright morning.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh afternoon, it's same.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At night if you want to see the lights then, yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then go on %uh the Singapore Flyer when you are %uh in the night time, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is the night scene out here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm I see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the first picture will be the day scene.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow, that's great.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um is that a tube, it's like a tube, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The-

utterances.transcript: %Uh a chew?

utterances.transcript: %Eh, %uh a chew, the one that you're going ride in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh sorry, I don't understand.

utterances.transcript: %Uh I mean the- it's like a tube, the fly- yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh a tube?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh okay, yes it's a capsule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is, yah, it's a glass capsule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um let me try and see- okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me just show you how the capsules looks like.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, now you can see here this picture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh okay this people are actually inside this capsule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it can actually take in about %uh twenty people in one capsule, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Twenty people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's a glass, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's glass %uh I will say, it looks like a bag.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so this is the Singapore Flyer.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um what about the dining?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um are we allowed to %um take a %uh even %um for example dinner or lunch?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay on normal days, we don't provide %uh dining in the capsule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This will be provided for special occasions like for example Valentine's day, yes we do %um %uh lunch or dinner that is provided inside this flyer.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, that's the capsule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A photo of the capsule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um otherwise if you just want to bring a bit of a snack, that's actually fine as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um how much it will cost %um for two people?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the Singapore Flyer will cost you twenty nine dollars and fifty cents %uh for one person for an adult.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The child will cost you twenty dollars and sixty five cent.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that would be for two person will be twenty nine, %uh fifty times two for two adults.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um that will be how long again?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's twenty minutes' ride?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, that's right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Twenty minutes, %oh that's great.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.transcript: %Um moving forward, %um what about in Universal Studio?

utterances.transcript: Okay, for the Universal Studio, there are lots of attractions there.

utterances.transcript: Okay, as you can see now on the screen, there are seven zones, alright.

utterances.transcript: There are rides like roller coaster if you're looking to be very exciting.

utterances.transcript: Roller coaster if you- Madagascar and our latest ride would be the Transformer.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: %Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, %um in %uh- what about in roller coaster %um, how much it will cost me if ever?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the price that you pay for admission to the Universal Studio includes %uh almost all the rides in Universal Studio.

utterances.transcript: %Hm, so-

utterances.transcript: Alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So, yes that is already included.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how much is that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the Universal admission is sixty eight dollars for weekday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Seventy four dollars for weekends and holidays.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Child will be fifty dollars %uh and fifty four for %uh public holidays and Sundays- %uh weekends.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um Lynnette %um what is the nearest hotel for the location that we would love to go to?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, closest hotel of course would be on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have a few %uh resort that is located on the Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For example %uh we have %um- okay, I'm going to show you the hotels, okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Crockford Hotel, %uh Hotel Michael, Hardrock Hotel, Festive Hotel, Equarius and Beach Villas.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so if you're talking about very close, these are the hotels.

utterances.transcript: Yes please.

utterances.transcript: %Uh much bet~

utterances.transcript: Four hundred dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And above for one room.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But they are-

utterances.transcript: It's quite expensive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: %Um what about

utterances.transcript: What about %um %uh I mean it's not %um- just not near in the Universal Studio?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What about %uh one ride or at least we can save more money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um a three-star hotel is okay or even the one, two-star hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, there is a very %uh a hotel, small hotel that is quite near to %uh- on the mainland that is quite near to the %uh Harbourfront where you will take the Sentosa Express to get on to the Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Harbourville.

utterances.transcript: %Um do you have any idea how much it will cost us %um for two days with two adults?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this one is in the region of %uh approximately %uh about a hundred and fifteen dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, per night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is the hotel.

utterances.transcript: It's just a small hotel %uh no %uh restaurant facilities.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you are talking about very close and this hotel is possible to walk to the %uh Harbourfront.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, now if you wanna a lit~ something a little bit better %uh I would say this hotel %uh just about %uh one stop away %uh from the Harbourfront.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay it's located in the Financial District Area.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this would be %uh a nicer hotel, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But otherwise %uh most of the hotels are even in Orchard Road is not that difficult to get to the Harbourfront.

utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %eh this one in M Hotel, how much it will cost us?

utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: Yes, correct.

utterances.transcript: %Hm %um wh~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Per night means you check-in at three o'clock, two o'clock, three o'clock, and you will have to leave the hotel by twelve the next day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that is %um the check-in advice us to stay for two days.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh less than one hundred dollars.

utterances.transcript: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that is good for two or only-

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The rates.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's great.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you are right in the heart of Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, because this hote~ %uh this %uh hotel is located in Chinatown, So there are lots of dining options.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are %um %uh restaurants, quite a lot of Chinese restaurants including dimsum, just next street and all the lanes around the Chinatown area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you like to have %um street food, there is a street food call the Chinatown Complex.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And over there %um they serve %uh local food, and one meal let's say if you are just having the %uh rice with three dishes, that will cost you approximately about five Singapore dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So with a drink it's less than seven dollars, you could have a full meal.

utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um if ever that %um we are in the Inn Hotel %eh at %uh Temple Street, %um how long it will for us to go to Sentosa, Singapore Flyer?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And what will be the ride that we can use to go there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Tem~ Okay, %uh this is very conveniently located.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the closest one of course would be the Chinatown MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The other ho~ %uh MRT would be Tanjong Pagar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now Tanjong Pagar is actually the East-West line that you will take to go to the %um Harbourfront, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but if you are, sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, no you take the Chinatown %uh station and go to the Harbourfront.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um but let say you are going to take %uh to the Singapore Flyer, then you will have to take from Tanjong Pagar and alight at the City Hall and you take a walk about fifteen min~ seventeen minutes' walk to the Singapore Flyer.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um in Sentosa, we just need to take the same subway, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh on Sentosa Island, we don't have subway.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have what we call the Sentosa buses, that you can board.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's all included in your ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can also board the train on Sentosa itself, we call it the Sentosa Express.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um what about Lynnette %um, do we need to get a visa for this?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um for example we just need to go there for a %uh two days trip.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do we need to get a visa?

utterances.transcript: A visa coming in to Singapore or a visa to Sentosa?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh which %uh visa are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um from here in our country to- for us to go to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay for your %uh and you are %uh holding a Philippine passport?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you won't require a visa to come to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And Sentosa Island is our, one of our island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there's no visa requirement.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh that's great.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So do you have any idea how much it will cost for a round trip ticket?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the flight tickets?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, again I think it depends on which airline that you are taking.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh ya really very much depending of the airlines that you are taking.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or would you be able to-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um do you have any %um- can you give me at least %um not quite expensive, %uh but %um more affordable airlines that we can buy a ticket?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: More affordable airlines coming to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I would think %uh do you have budget airlines coming in?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Actually our budget %um is one thousand Singaporean dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you have the Cebupacific airlines coming into Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, we do.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, I think that would be a cheaper ticket coming in from %um Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Coming in to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um what about %um the weather or do you have any advance weather forecast %um for the specific date that we'll %uh like to go?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have the same kind of temperature throughout the whole year.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so there's no %uh really specific time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, maybe I'll just give you a run down %um. I would say that it will be good to time your holidays %uh together with our major festivals here like February or January period will be Chinese New Year.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it gives you that festive mood.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh the Hari Raya sometime in %uh August, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Deepavali-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: August?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, sometime in November.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And Christmas time is also a very festive because, %uh we light up the whole street of Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it gives you that very festive mood.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um the rest of the Hari Raya, Deepavali, we light up other streets in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that gives you a very good a photography area for you to bring home %uh some memories of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, some souvenir picture.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um what about this coming April?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You don't have any festival?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, we don't have major festival in the month of April.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um %uh we also like to go to Singapore Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can you tell me more about that %eh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um how long %um it will take for us to go there from the hotel that you gave it to u~ %uh to the hotel that you gave it to me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you will have to %uh- the MRT ride will take you approximately about forty five minutes to get to the northern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you will alight at the MRT train station called the Ang Mo Kio station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from there, you change a bus number one three eight, to get to the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it will be better for you to allocate at least about one and a half hours from the hotel to the Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um in the Night Safari,  %um what time the park will be open?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The park will be open from %uh seven thirty in the night time to twelve midnight.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Twelve midnight?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much it will be %um the entrance fee?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The entrance fee will be thirty two dollars for an adult, and a child will be twenty one dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That already include the tram ride?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, the tram ride is included %uh for the %uh price that I have quoted you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's great.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um are we allowed to feed the animals or something?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is a wild park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That means the animals are not tame, so %uh yes we do not %uh encourage anyone to feed the animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are well-taken care of %uh by the zoo keepers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and they have %uh regular feeding time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we don't want the animals to put on too much weight.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they will be eating the wrong kind food if we give them the human food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they have special %uh food that the zoo keepers will feed them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So strictly no feeding.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and also %uh we- for the Night Safari, because these animals, most of the animals are nocturnal creatures.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so if you're going to take photography %uh on the animals, then please switch off your %um flashlights.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm so fla~ the flash of to the camera is not allowed for- when we take pictures?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we do not %uh want to damage the eyes of these %uh nocturnal creatures, because being nocturnal creatures, they have very sharp %uh eyesight.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we don't want to damage %uh their eyes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that's why we don't want any flash photographies on the animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you want to take pictures of your friends or %uh just the backdrop, %uh without the animals, yes, then you can take %uh pictures with the flash.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Flash, I see that great.
